snippet.title: Language shapes perception
snippet.description:
Where did I get the inspiration for the name " Language shapes perception"? 
* The idea that language can shape perception and thought — a hypothesis formally known as “linguistic relativity” — harkens back to the 1930s. This hypothesis asserts that language doesn't just express ideas, it actively shapes them, determining how we understand the world around us. 

Videos, Lectures and Audiobooks about Languages, Linguistics, Psychology, History of Language, and Learning 

If you are interested in these fields, SUBSCRIBE to this channel! 

Thank you!  : )
